motions.title: Consent Agenda Approval
motions.description: Approval of consent agenda including: • Approval of January 9, 2023, City Council Meeting Minutes • Approval of 5-Year Contract Extension with Axon Enterprise, Inc. for Body Worn Cameras • Approval of 5-Year Contract Extension with Axon Enterprise, Inc. for In-Car Video Cameras • Contract for 2023 Pavement Resurfacing • Funding Authorization for 2419 Redcliff Way Storm Repairs

motions.title: Motion to Enter Executive Session
motions.description: Motion to enter executive session for cyber security, real estate, and litigation discussion.

specialEvents.title: Boy Scout Recognition
specialEvents.description: Two Boy Scouts from Troop 266 introduced themselves and were welcomed by Mayor Deutsch, noted they are working on badges.

presentations.title: Spruill Center for the Arts Annual Presentation
presentations.description: Presentation by CEO Alan Mothner on past year accomplishments and 2023 goals, reviewing four key objectives: relevance, systems & operations, people, and financial. Enrollment returned to pre-pandemic levels.

discussionItems.title: Edge City 2.0
discussionItems.description: Final presentation of Edge City 2.0 by Andrew Korr (Pond & Company) and Andrew Fayn covering strategic implementation actions, urban/city/town/village nodes, economic impacts, and three initiatives: redevelopment facilitation, Perimeter Village concept, and mobility strategy.
discussionItems.presenter: Michael Starling, Andrew Korr, and Andrew Fayn

discussionItems.title: Facility Usage Agreement with Peachtree Club Softball
discussionItems.description: Presentation of Peachtree Club Softball Facility Usage Agreement to allow use of Brook Run Park ball fields.

discussionItems.title: Authorization for 2023 Community Survey Contract
discussionItems.description: Contract with Probolsky Research for 2023 Community Survey - RFP released, 3 responses received, recommended award to Probolsky Research for amount not to exceed $20,000.
